verses.kjv: Now concerning spiritual gifts, brethren, I would not have you ignorant.
verses.ct: Now, brothers and sisters, I want you to be well-informed about spiritual gifts.

verses.kjv: Ye know that ye were Gentiles, carried away unto these dumb idols, even as ye were led.
verses.ct: You remember that when you were pagans, you were somehow drawn away and led astray toward idols that cannot speak.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I give you to understand, that no man speaking by the Spirit of God calleth Jesus accursed: and that no man can say that Jesus is the Lord, but by the Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: So I want you to understand this: no one who is speaking through God's Spirit says, 'Jesus is cursed,' and no one can genuinely declare, 'Jesus is Lord,' except through the Holy Spirit.

verses.kjv: Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.
verses.ct: There are many different kinds of gifts, but they all come from the same Spirit.

verses.kjv: And there are differences of administrations, but the same Lord.
verses.ct: There are many different kinds of service, but they are all directed by the same Lord.

verses.kjv: And there are diversities of operations, but it is the same God which worketh all in all.
verses.ct: There are many different ways God works, but it is the same God who produces all of them in everyone.

verses.kjv: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal.
verses.ct: The Spirit reveals himself through each person in a way that benefits everyone.

verses.kjv: For to one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom; to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit;
verses.ct: The Spirit gives one person a message of wisdom, while another receives a message of knowledge through that same Spirit.

verses.kjv: To another faith by the same Spirit; to another the gifts of healing by the same Spirit;
verses.ct: To another person the same Spirit gives faith, and to yet another that same Spirit gives gifts of healing.

verses.kjv: To another the working of miracles; to another prophecy; to another discerning of spirits; to another divers kinds of tongues; to another the interpretation of tongues:
verses.ct: One person receives the ability to perform miracles, another the ability to prophesy, another the ability to distinguish between spirits, another the ability to speak in different tongues, and another the ability to interpret those tongues.

verses.kjv: But all these worketh that one and the selfsame Spirit, dividing to every man severally as he will.
verses.ct: But one and the same Spirit produces all of these, distributing them to each person individually just as he chooses.

verses.kjv: For as the body is one, and hath many members, and all the members of that one body, being many, are one body: so also is Christ.
verses.ct: A human body is a single unit, yet it has many parts. Even though there are many parts, they all form one body. It's the same way with Christ.

verses.kjv: For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, whether we be Jews or Gentiles, whether we be bond or free; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.
verses.ct: We were all baptized by one Spirit into one body — whether Jewish or Gentile, whether slave or free — and we were all given one Spirit to drink.

verses.kjv: For the body is not one member, but many.
verses.ct: After all, the body isn't made up of just one part but of many.

verses.kjv: If the foot shall say, Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?
verses.ct: If the foot were to say, 'Since I'm not a hand, I don't belong to the body,' that wouldn't actually make it any less a part of the body.

verses.kjv: And if the ear shall say, Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?
verses.ct: If the ear were to say, 'Since I'm not an eye, I don't belong to the body,' that wouldn't actually make it any less a part of the body either.

verses.kjv: If the whole body were an eye, where were the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where were the smelling?
verses.ct: If the entire body were an eye, how would you hear anything? If the entire body were an ear, how would you smell anything?

verses.kjv: But now hath God set the members every one of them in the body, as it hath pleased him.
verses.ct: But God has arranged every single part in the body exactly where he wanted it.

verses.kjv: And if they were all one member, where were the body?
verses.ct: If everything were just one part, how could there even be a body?

verses.kjv: But now are they many members, yet but one body.
verses.ct: The reality is that there are many parts, but they still form one body.

verses.kjv: And the eye cannot say unto the hand, I have no need of thee: nor again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.
verses.ct: The eye can't tell the hand, 'I don't need you!' And the head can't tell the feet, 'I don't need you!'

verses.kjv: Nay, much more those members of the body, which seem to be more feeble, are necessary:
verses.ct: No — in fact, the parts of the body that appear to be the weakest are actually the most essential.

verses.kjv: And those members of the body, which we think to be less honourable, upon these we bestow more abundant honour; and our uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness.
verses.ct: The parts of the body that we consider less dignified, we treat with extra care. And the parts that aren't attractive, we give special attention to.

verses.kjv: For our comely parts have no need: but God hath tempered the body together, having given more abundant honour to that part which lacked:
verses.ct: Our more presentable parts don't require this kind of treatment. But God has put the body together in such a way that extra honor goes to the parts that lack it,

verses.kjv: That there should be no schism in the body; but that the members should have the same care one for another.
verses.ct: so that there would be no division within the body, but instead every part would show equal concern for all the others.

verses.kjv: And whether one member suffer, all the members suffer with it; or one member be honoured, all the members rejoice with it.
verses.ct: When one part suffers, every part suffers along with it. When one part is honored, every part celebrates with it.

verses.kjv: Now ye are the body of Christ, and members in particular.
verses.ct: Together, you are the body of Christ, and each of you individually is a part of it.

verses.kjv: And God hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondarily prophets, thirdly teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, diversities of tongues.
verses.ct: God has appointed people in the church in this order: first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then those who perform miracles, then those with gifts of healing, those who help others, those who provide leadership, and those who speak in different tongues.

verses.kjv: Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all workers of miracles?
verses.ct: Is everyone an apostle? Is everyone a prophet? Is everyone a teacher? Does everyone perform miracles?

verses.kjv: Have all the gifts of healing? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?
verses.ct: Does everyone have gifts of healing? Does everyone speak in tongues? Does everyone interpret?

verses.kjv: But covet earnestly the best gifts: and yet shew I unto you a more excellent way.
verses.ct: Eagerly pursue the greater gifts. And now I'm going to show you a path that surpasses them all.
